Q11 Are there any items which the fire can't destroy?
On january 11, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

The cause of death for someone suffering from mush allergy isn't even on the French wiki because it's very rare. As most other causes of deaths are known, I can't be totally sure, but it's most probable.

A 11
There are items that can be damaged but not destroyed (apron, glove, extinguishers, drones, scooter, some artefacts...), and others that can never be destroyed or damaged (wrench, medikit, scrap metal, space capsules, probably starmap fragments, and others that I'm forgetting).

Q14 Can someone explain me what janice's 3rd skill does?I have read it in the wiki but i dont understand.
On january 11, 2014
Secondary

A14 well lets say that you have got plasma shield and raluca is working on it and she has physicist then she has 5-7% on it but if janice has her third skill raluca will always do 7% on her first advancment then if noone resets for her it will always be 4% so there is no chance that you will get 5% instead of 7
On january 11, 2014
Pyrrhus

A14 expanded/simplified Simply put, the percentage increase when someone progresses a NERON project will always be at the upper limit of the range that you would get otherwise. For example, if progressing once normally would give between 12% to 18%, the percentage increase will be 18%.
The next time you progress will be at the maximum of the normal range that you get after progressing it normally, say in the example the range would be 8% to 11%, the increase would be 11%.

It allows a (sizeable and active) project team to get through NERON projects much faster because they get the highest percentages one after the other. With a small or inactive group, it isn't as great as having IT Expert as that skill gives 2 free uses per day and gives boosts to 4 NERON Projects, two of which make it easier to complete projects faster, one of those further synergised by Janice's shrink skill.

Q19: Who dies first of O2 loss... humans or mush? Or the cat?

On january 11, 2014
Cimanyd
ZaphodBeeblbroxQ19: Who dies first of O2 loss... humans or mush? Or the cat?

A19
One person, randomly, is picked when the oxygen's 0. Whether the person is human or mush doesn't have anything to do with it. If they're holding at least 1 oxygen capsule, it's used up, otherwise they die. If you're mush, the oxygen is low (but not gone), and you're worried about staying alive, you could take out some oxygen capsules and hope no one notices you were the one that did it.

Q22: How exactly does "NERON's only friend" skill function? How would this skill benefit Janice and the others?
On january 11, 2014
Cimanyd
JorgeLinusQ22: How exactly does "NERON's only friend" skill function? How would this skill benefit Janice and the others?

A22
It increases the progress for everyone on NERON projects to the maximum. So, if there's a project you can advance at 12%-18%, your possible advancement amount becomes 18%-18% if Janice has the skill. It applies to everyone.

Q28 How do I make a line break in chat?
On january 12, 2014
Mystaira

A28: By using 4 dashes (-) at the beginning of a line. Though that doesn't always work unless it is on a new line to begin with. (which you may have to type up outside the regular box)
On january 12, 2014
[6826491]

A28: On the very last character of the message box, hit ctrl+enter. Then press the space bar once, and hit ctrl+enter again. Adding a line break in this way only works if the cursor is at the very end of whatever has already been typed.

Note that if you want to insert a line break in the middle of whatever you've typed, there's a workaround for that, too. Highlight the text below where the line break should be, cut it, add your line break as noted above (since it's now the "end" of the text) and then paste your text back in.

On january 13, 2014
[7950824]

A32 addendum: There's also the rules, which prohibit surrender or playing against your team.

In terms of your mush score, there's points gained for things like being the last player on the ship. There's also things you can learn and experiment with near the end of the ship's life that would make absolutely no sense to do when the ship isn't about to die and you cannot find a way to save it.

If you're a tech, consider dismantling equipment you are sure will never be used again, and see what parts you get from it - who knows, maybe it's something that could help the desperate situation.

Focus on one part of the ship and see how efficiently that little bit can be worked on.

Pay attention to what the end days do to the teamwork and trust of the others on the ship, and how it affects yourself.

There's other things to do in 'the end days'... and lessons you learn can help your future ships do better.

[6826491]

A36: Your max. HP and Morale drop to 14, but you keep your currently equipped skills. If you don't have enough skills to select to fill all four skill slots, or if you intentionally waited to choose your skills, you lose the last two skill slots (if either are empty). You obviously won't be able to choose new skills for the lost skill slots. You keep your iTrakie, of course. On your next ship, you'll be Silver (or Bronze, if your Gold days were gifted.)

Everything else should stay the same.
On january 13, 2014

Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

It doesn't matter if the cat is mush when you go back to Sol. It only matters when you go to Eden (the humans lose 8 if the cat is infected, and 4, I think, if he is dead, whereas they gain 4 if he is alive and healthy).

But you won't lose or gain anything when you go back to Sol, so you don't have to kill him. You only need to be careful and avoid manipulating him, so as not to be converted accidentally.

[6826491]

Impet is correct. Someone whose morale hits zero during a cycle won't die immediately. In fact, if they gain morale through any means before the cycle change hits, they'll survive, at least morale-wise. That's why Demoralize is best used right at the end of a cycle, so they won't have time to react.

On january 14, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Not exactly. The Xyloph list can give negative names (humans, or at least non alpha mush) and inconclusive results (names picked at random that can either be human or mush). If someone is on the Xyloph list with "inconclusive sample", it does not mean that they could be mush. In fact it doesn't mean anything.

Negative names are what matters on that list. If, for example, Eleesha's list has Finola, Terrence, Stephen, Jin Su and Paola on it, and the Xyloph list says Jin Su and Terrence are negative, then you can cross them out of Eleesha's list.

On january 15, 2014
[7911730]

q68. Can you use Astropad to cheat and find hidden objects?
On january 15, 2014
Avistew
Lab Rat Felinophile

A68: No. Astropad doesn't show hidden objects. It shows things exactly as you would see them yourself at the time it's updated. You can "hide" objects by taking them on you before you update, making it look like they're not there, but if anyone goes to that room you'll be found out. But if an item is hidden, you won't be able to see it (unless astropad was updated last before the item was hidden. Then it would still show).

[7921689]

On january 15, 2014
[7950824]

A69 Human inactives will die on their own. It might take a while, but if they are inactive and stay inactive they'll die from morale loss or starvation. There's an AP cost to killing, and there's sometimes diseases gained from witnessing death, and too you can get injured trying to attack someone. All those are part of the cost of killing inactives - and if a player is inactive, how dangerous are they? Sometimes there's a need to rush that makes the costs worthwhile.
On january 15, 2014
[6826491]
rook42

q68: Was on a ship that was killing off all the inactives.... Is this horrifically awkward, or is it just me?

I feel like i'd be annoyed as nonvital crew(Ian, gioele,terrence, whatever) being killed for inactivity. Active crew had mush-tested via food.

It's not "random". And there's crew consensus. But the purge feels quite off, if only for all the wasted morale.

A69: Killing people just because they're inactive may be sanctionable. It's shortsighted, it's a weak excuse at best, and it can really hurt the ship in the long run, especially if one of those inactives could have returned to the game. Also, if they die of depression, the rest of the crew doesn't suffer a morale loss. Then there's also the fact that if you start to suffocate, then you've just increased the odds that an active player will die next.

If they're causing direct harm to the ship (say, if they're inactive on the bridge, and wasting Paola's Logistics, for example) that's a bit more understandable. If they're holding onto a crucial item, say the Apron, then that is causing tangible negative effects for the rest of the crew. If they went inactive on Day 1, didn't eat, and it's now late in Day 5, then you have good reason to suspect they're Mush, because they probably would have starved by then.

These are just a few examples of legitimate reasons to kill an inactive, and the list isn't exhaustive. But the decision to kill someone shouldn't be taken so lightly. It costs AP, not to mention the morale costs, and if you're killing inactives in hope of finding a Mush among them, then you haven't done much investigating.

If they're inactive and taking up a bed, kick them out of it, but you don't need to kill them just for inactivity. IF they present a threat to the ship, or are interfering with ship operations, then do what you must.

Kat69Can you elaborate about Paola's list.. We printed one but it had like 7 inconclusive results.. Is it as same as Eleesha's? Like with one alpha mush and others red herring?

Inconclusive results don't mean anything. It does not work like Eleesha's list, you could have 7 humans on that list and no mush.

On january 15, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 72
Every cycle, the project has 15 % chance to prevent all incidents. It only works when something was supposed to happen : first the RNG decides that one or several incidents are going to take place, then the project has 15 % to prevent it.

When the project works, nothing happens that cycle : no broken equipment, no room shaking, no steel plates, no fires, no electrical spikes (and maybe no panic attacks, but I'm not sure). You can only get hunters.

Cimanyd

The Retro-Fungal Serum research has two effects, they have nothing to do with each other.

Everyone gets glory, and more glory if they return to Sol (maybe if Eden, too?).

A serum object is created, and can be used on one character, which uses it up.

The object has nothing to do with the glory. If you're considering "wins" in the terms of what's good based on the story, the research is important, not the object. If you research the serum and use the object, then return to Sol, you know how to cure humanity of the mush and could make more serum when you get there.

justlikethat

*A85* It costs 2 fuel to reach the orbit of this planet, no extra fuel needed for turning around. In fact, if you put more than 2 fuel into the combustion chamber, you will miss the planet.

Once you've explored the planet, you need to load 1 fuel into the combustion chamber to be able to leave orbit.

You can start scanning for a new planet only after you've left orbit, and all planets that you scanned before visiting that planet are lost.

[6826491]

A85d: You use up all the fuel in the chamber the moment you Advance the ship. That's why the heading and fuel loaded must exactly match the distance to the destination planet. If either one doesn't match up, you will end up missing the planet you wanted to go to.

Note that when you move the ship, you lose all the planets you've scanned (except for the planet you are hopefully about to reach) so make sure all that AP spent scanning isn't wasted. And if your current destination is empty space, then you'll have to start scanning all over again. The Commander's role isn't an easy one.

[6826491]
Afterwind11Q65: Does leaving the bridge resets your hacking chance?

A65: Just had to clarify this one. No, not necessarily. What resets your hacking chance is spending any AP on another action, including AP -> MP conversion. If say you were trying to hack the ship and move it, and you had enough MP saved up to run to the Refectory and back, you could eat and try again with the same chance.

But if even one AP is spent before you get back to hacking, your progress will reset. So if you run to the Refectory in the example I gave, cooking that ration normally would reset your progress, but quick cooking it or eating it uncooked would not reset your progress.

This mechanic (no pun intended) also applies to repairing items, or firing from turrets. As long as you don't spend AP in any other way, your percentage will remain until you either succeed in the action, or spend AP on something else.
On january 21, 2014
Rain

[6826491]

On paper, it sure sounds good. Catch them after a shower, if they don't have splashproof...one lucky shot, and you've killed a Mush. But that's just it, it only sounds good. It's terrible in practice, because of everything that can go wrong with it. That's NOT factoring in the AP cost to heal the HP of a human target, much less the surgery involved in extreme cases. It's a terrible test, and if I'm a Mush when someone suggests it, I'll push for it to first be used on the person who suggested it, unless they're Chun. Hell, I might even take the rifle and shoot them myself! That should be enough to discourage them from ever suggesting it to "test" anyone again.

Because the Natamy rifle inflicts 6-13 damage and wounds, and because wounds indirectly inflict damage. sperbi

A83: yes, yes, yes, ^^ (so back to my question )

(I think drooling has something to do with reassigning of titles.. so I can ask also how long does it take if someone is waking up, title got reassigned and is going off again until the title is switching again?)
On january 22, 2014
[6826491]

A82: Full AP at the end of a cycle = inactive. If they log in, even if they take no actions, they become active again. And if they take no actions, they will be inactive again at the end of the current cycle, and the title will switch. A title holder who does this repeatedly may very well be killed for it, depending upon the title. Admin doesn't often matter too much in this regard, but Commander and Comms, definitely so.

A title holder who logs in repeatedly to take their title back, but takes no actions, is a threat to the ship. Key emphasis on repeatedly, there. If they only do it once, and stay inactive afterward, you might let it go, without wasting your AP on killing them. But if they do so 2-3 times or more, and don't do anything each time...I would strongly consider that to be a justified kill.

On january 23, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

If you really want to infect Eleesha, the safest strategy is to find other methods than direct spiking, because it's quite risky to attempt direct spiking if she has the Observant skill.

If the skill works, your action will be visible not only to Eleesha, but to everyone else, as if Eleesha was a camera. It is simultaneous, she doesn't have to search or do anything (in fact she has no control over that skill). If she doesn't reveal the action immediately, it can't be revealed later.

Q122: Is killing griefers a reportable offense?
On january 27, 2014
Secondary

A122 no, report the griefers and kill them. If they report you then you would probably be cleared.
On january 27, 2014
[6826491]

A122: If they're actively griefing, the best thing you can do is to kill and report them. If the judges determine that their behavior wasn't actually griefing, then the worst thing that can happen is that the person who did the reporting may get a sanction for report abuse. More likely however, the reported player will be cleared, if in the opinion of the judges, they weren't griefing.

However...it should be said that if you have a legitimate reason to make your report, then please do so. We'd rather you report someone who might be griefing, than to let it slide so they can do it again on their next ship. As long as you make the report in good faith, then you won't have to worry about report abuse. Reports aren't to be made to solve players' personal issues, however...and some people just don't seem to understand that. Please don't report people over personal issues. If you have good reason to believe that rules are being broken, let us know with a report, and let the SDF handle it from there. Disruptive players need to be investigated and sanctioned as the situation warrants, for the good of the playerbase. That includes griefers, as well as those who surrender/suicide.
On january 27, 2014
Asscout

Q123 Can Map Fragments be destroyed by fire? Is there a list somewhere to know whether an item is destroyed or broken by fire?
On january 27, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 123

As far as I know, they can't be destroyed or damaged.

Objects that can be destroyed :
- consumables (rations, pills, coffees, fruits)
- plants
- hydropots
- mage books
- documents (post-its, the 2 lists)
- soap
- fuel capsules
- blueprints

Objects that can be damaged :
- scooter
- protective gloves
- spacesuits
- ropes
- hacker kit
- apron
- fire extinguishers
- alien TV
- oscilloscope
- iTrakie, walkie talkie, tracker
- magellan liquid map
- drones
- mycoalarms
- and others that I'm forgetting

Objects that are not affected by fire :
- medikit
- wrench
- starmap fragments
- scrap metal
- alien opener
- oxygen capsules

I don't think the retro-fungal serum, the mush sample, the genome disk and the cat can be destroyed or damaged. Not sure about the weapons either but I think they're safe too.

worth to note that the grenade does the same thing to all or most of them and probably the rocket launcher too, my ship just lost its soap to an grenade, the grenade is actualy pretty dangerous even if it doesnt do much damage as it can destroy and break things and it can cause some very AP costly wounds like burnt arms
On january 27, 2014
[7897795]

Q124: What'd qualify as personal issues, then? Not getting along with someone/reporting people you don't like?
On january 27, 2014
[6826491]

A124: Sadly, yes. It's one thing if they're actively causing harm to the ship, interfering with ship operations, and so on. Or if they're breaking the site rules (excessive swearing, insults, etc.) Those are a few of the many legitimate reasons to file a report.

But it's another matter to report someone because they didn't like you, or threatened you because (as an example) you were holding onto (for several cycles) an item for that should be shared, like the Apron. Yes, we've actually seen people report players who "didn't like them" or "were mean to them". And yes, even reports because of someone threatening to kill someone who was holding onto an item the ship needed to share.

Don't get me wrong, if someone is being highly insulting or threatening someone without just cause, and it's hurting the ship, a report may be in order. If they're threatening to kill someone who is holding a needed item and refuses to drop it... they're probably acting in the best interest of the ship, and the one doing the reporting may see a report abuse sanction.

Q138: at the end of the game, it asks us to click a player if we "liked" them on that ship. is it possible to find out who liked us?
-

On january 29, 2014
spacekadt
goatQ138: at the end of the game, it asks us to click a player if we "liked" them on that ship. is it possible to find out who liked us?
-
i checkd my mush file and only shows days i survived, glory, etc..

You can't see *who* liked you, but you can see how many likes you received by going to the "My File" page under My Account. You can see the total by clicking the third tab in your distinctions box (Consumable Icons) or you can see per ship by clicking on your glory listings for each individual voyage you completed. You will only see these *after* everyone has confirmed their death or 7 days after the ship ends... just like the names of other players.

Q156Can a Mush receive the illness event in a expedition but don't show afterward the syndrome once he come back to the ship? I know that the wiki say that Mush can't be sick i'm still confused about that and all the vomit thing, if a character vomit can we be safe that he is Human?
On january 31, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 155
Mush don't get casting tickets.

A 156
Yes, they can. But they will only have a message saying that they have caught an illness. They won't have the status or the symptoms. If you see someone vomit, sneeze, scratch, or if someone is cured of an illness, then they are human.
On january 31, 2014
[6826491]
SegylQ156: Can a Mush receive the illness event in a expedition but don't show afterward the syndrome once he come back to the ship? I know that the wiki say that Mush can't be sick i'm still confused about that and all the vomit thing, if a character vomit can we be safe that he is Human?

A156: They can't get illnesses after they become Mush. So they can see the event stating that they become ill, but they aren't affected by it. So if you see someone vomiting right after an expo, they aren't Mush, at least at that moment.

The trick is, if you heal someone, and they were supposed to have a physical illness, there will be a message in the log about HP being healed, but not about an illness being cured (or treated.) Illnesses being treated or cured are always displayed in the room log. It's an easy (but risky) way to expose a Mush, since they might have the Traitor skill, and increase the chance of someone getting seriously injured or killed on that expo. Illnesses can also be a way to clear someone of being a Mush, at least for the moment. People who have been cleared of suspicion are tempting targets for a Transfer.

If the illness is a mental one, then time in bed with a Shrink should cure it...but again, if the person doesn't have any log messages about needing more sessions or being cured of it, then they're Mush.

Mush can get wounds just like humans can, and those will generally require surgery. Don't confuse wounds for illnesses, though; or you might clear a Mush of suspicion.

Q161 Can patrol ships being broken randomly? I know only that they can be sabotaged. Also, if they can break randomly, can it matter to patrol ship when flying with it? (Something- not exact thing, cause I know that NERON doesn't annonce which part of equipment has been broken exactly. Or I'm not sure here also?)
On february 1, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 161
Patrol ships can :
- break randomly at cycle change (announced by Neron on the discussion channel)
- be broken by a fire (announced in the room logs)
- be broken by an electrical spike (not announced at all)
- be sabotaged (not announced at all)

Whatever the cause, it will always be shown in the alerts bar, whether someone reports it or not. (It is the same for all equipment, not just for patrol ships.) And a single patrol ship will be shown as 2 broken things.

When a patrol ship is outside, it can only be sabotaged by the person piloting it. But it can be damaged by a fire or an electrical spike in the bay while it is outside.

If a patrol ship is broken, you can't take off with it. If you are inside it and outside the Daedalus when it breaks, you can't do anything until you have repaired it.

Q139: Can i send gold days to players already owning some?
Q139a: If yes, am i allowed to trade tickets for days?
On february 1, 2014
Pyrrhus

A139 No, Gold Days can't be sent to other players like Hero Days in Die2Nite can be given to players (E.g. If you have 20 gold days, there isn't an ability to choose to give 5 of them to a player).
I think there IS some capacity to get gold days for other players through some sort of tokens which are available through the French version of Mush/Twinoid but not the English but I'm not sure about it anymore because of faulty memory.
A139a Nope, casting tickets are only for the casting mechanism, which also isn't utilised in the English version of Mush yet.
On february 1, 2014
[6826491]

A139: Actually, you CAN send Gold days to someone else, even if they are someone who already has them, If they're on a ship, one day is immediately counted, so you're technically sending them six days. You can send Gold days at a rate of seven at a time, with one being lost in the exchange. I know that this works, because I've done so myself. Others have reported that one day is lost in the exchange, even if the other person isn't on a ship. I've seen that happen as well, so be forewarned. One other thing of note is that sending Gold days to someone doesn't trigger the Welcome Pack bonus - for that, they have to obtain Gold days normally.

A139a: You can send five Casting Tickets at a time to someone, but as Pyrrhus stated, Castings aren't available on the English version yet. I've not sent Casting Tickets to anyone else, but the system presumably works as intended.

In both of these cases, you can send them via the My Account --> My Settings tab.

A173: Suicide isn't an option, though technically...leaving you to die IS. It's strictly up to them, though. You might manage to stop the HP loss, and then fix the legs. You'll need at least 8 AP though, and there is a chance for the surgery to fail. But hey, it might be worth all the trouble; if you're fully operational again (no pun intended) then your ship will have another active member, and they avoid the morale loss from your death...at least for the near future.

Pyrrhus
Too_TonQ174 If I fail at Chun by only staying in the research room, are people allowed to kill me?

A175 No, unless a human player is deliberately messing up a mission critical job and by doing so is putting the Crew's interests at risks, e.g. a Commander that is decidedly against moving the ship to a planet with O2, Fruit and Food when you're about to asphyxiate, or someone who is progressing useless projects against the crew's wishes, then it's generally agreed that it's okay to kill them. Generally.
However, it is completely ridiculous to kill someone who just stands around or does other things than what they're supposed to in an ideal world, but is not directly harming the crew. In fact, killing people like that both wastes AP/MP spent on killing them, drops crew morale and removes a healthy, productive body on a very dangerous ship on a very dangerous journey. In that case, like in yours, it's in your interest to report the murder.

Also, Chun doesn't really have a job beside being a safe voice in the crew to listen to and talk to, and being around for and helping research, that is until after/if the Chun ghost is obtained, so you're not failing anyway.
On february 2, 2014
[1757645]

A175 The ONLY reason for the crew to kill Chun would be if she were actively griefing. (Like grabbing the Genome Disk and standing around in a turret.) Otherwise there isn't a good reason.
In fact, just standing around inactive in the Lab is actually helping the crew, since they need you there for research. You'll probably find the crew using Comfort on you and healing you with the MedKit just to keep you alive.

Cimanyd
bootstrap666Q177 Apologies if this has been asked before but i haven't been able to find the answer, I'm a gold member and whenever i start a new game all the skills i've selected before are already selected. I have Paola upgraded to level 5, how do i swap out the level 5 skill for one of the other 4? All the answers i've found say that once the game is over you will be able to repick your skills, but it doesn't actually say how to do it.

A177
Here's how that works.
If, when you wake up at the beginning of a game, you have the same number of skills available as slots available, they're all automatically filled in.
If you have more available skills than slots when you wake up, none are automatically selected. You start with no skills at all, and if you click on an empty skill slot you can choose any of the available skills to fill it.

On february 2, 2014
vidgin

I have observant Skill. It has a 25% chance of detecting covert activity. When I will click "Search" 20 times, I will can detect covert activity on 20 click? Or after the first searching failed, others would have the same results, wouldn't they?
On february 2, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Those are two different things. "Search" enables you to find hidden items in the room. Anybody can do that, the only difference is that for you, it costs 0 AP. If you don't find anything the first time, it means that there is nothing hidden in the room. If you find a hidden object, you can try again, because there may be other hidden things.

The detection of covert actions is automatic, you can't control it. When a covert action (for example spiking) occurs in the room, you have 25 % of revealing it, as if you were a camera. The action will then be visible for everyone in the room logs.

On february 4, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

Wounds don't cause direct damage when you get them, but they immediately reduce your max HP, before the loss of HP caused by the weapon. Some of them can reduce your max HP for much more than 1 point. For example, I think it's 2 for Damaged ears and 5 for Open-air brain, and it's cumulative if you have several wounds.

A205: After the Mush are dead, Chun can take on quite a few different roles. I've noticed some new people tend to find Chun boring, but she's the one everyone trusts, and that role tends to get not just underplayed, but virtually forgotten. A206: Tell them that the best places to keep extinguishers are the corridors, and to always update the Extinguishers thread with their current locations. One thing about post-its though...they don't actually prevent items from burning. Every item in a room has a chance of burning each cycle, and each gets tested separately. So a Post-it burning wouldn't prevent another item from burning, it would just burn, too. That "trick" doesn't actually work.

Post-its are still wonderful to have on expos, however.

A209 I think that the natamy rifle is a quite sure way to tell whether someone is mush or not.
For human it deals 2-4 damage (according to the wiki) and for mush it deals 6-13 damage.
You can also get wounds that may increase your max HP, but also your current HP, so the max number for humans to be away from max HP after you shot them once with the rifle is 4 points.
So if you have got the better medkit healing 4 or a medic healing 5 and then you heal them once after you shot them once (of course be sure that they are at full HP before this) and they are still healable then they have to be mush.
We used this on my current ship to test someone who was quite suspicious to us. We shot him twice because the first shot missed and afterwards we healed him once. He was at full HP again and so he was a proven human (he was human indeed).
From this 2 shots of which one missed he received one wound that was critical haemorrhage and we did surgery on him at the same cycle to heal him.

All in all it should be possible to test someone with the rifle, but its quite risky since you may get up to 3 wounds from one shot and some decrease your max HP for 6 points.
So if you want to use it be sure that this person will be online soon again and that you have got a medic who can perform surgery on other people, then te chance should be very low that this person will die. (assuming that the person is human )

[6826491]

A221: At the very last character of the textbox, hit CTRL+enter, followed by the spacebar once. Then hit CTRL+enter again, and then that will maintain the line break. This ONLY works if you are at the end of anything you have already typed.

If you want to insert the line break in the middle of what you've already typed, you CAN, but you have to cut the text past the point where you want the line break, first. Then you insert your line break as normal, and paste the cut text back in, after the line break. If you want to practice it, you can create a PM conversation for it, but don't invite anyone...and you'll avoid spamming the general chat.

A223: Sometimes it's a good thing if you become ill after witnessing a death: If you haven't been proven to be human yet, then at least at that moment, you are. Mush can't get illnesses after they become converted.

goathey man a dude on my ship got death because of that, but does that mean he can't play mush forever? or just a certain period of time [Q224 dang these questions flying by fast]

A224: We're not at liberty to discuss the exact length of quarantines, at the request of the devs...but I can tell you that if that player got quarantined, there is about a 98% chance that it was entirely deserved. If it wasn't, they can appeal it; but the vast majority of the time, they have been quarantined because they earned it.

JaceotQ225. How many shots do pilot drones shoot per cycle? What if they have turbo?

A225: Once per cycle, or they land as their action, if no hostiles are present. If they have Turbo, they may shoot twice, or shoot and land. But bear in mind that Turbo only has an 80% chance of activating, so they might not always act twice.

Fun fact: You can take a Pilot drone with you when you take off...and if you've shot down all the hunters, AND no new ones show up the following cycle, the drone should land the ship for free next cycle.

I've never tried it in the Pasiphae, so I'm not sure if it will safely land you in that case.

AndreQ278 which would you choose: Hydroponic Incubator or Armored Corridors. If you have an Plasma Shield at 100, hull near 90, a bunch of scrap metall to repair it again and an Tech to do it better and you also have all plants grown up already and most of them alien plants so not much crossbreed required anymore.

A278
Armored corridors reduce damage of all shots by -1, even when hitting Plasma Shield. Can help on that ship if crew is shooting for Eden or many days.
Hydroponic Incubator makes it easier not just to 'crossbreed' (which is actually just grafting) but any fruits that are planted to get to adulthood, which is nice if you want to have LOTS of the same kind of fruit (e.g. 3AP fruit) or pharmaceutical plants that heal conditions your pills don't.
It's largely up to the crew what they want; longer lasting shield and ship, or more AP

Blandshee

Q279. With diplomat, are Fight events removed or replaced with nothing?

Practical example: If I have Diplomat, and we have an expedition with a likely Mankarog, is the chance he turns someone into a chunky paste 33% or 25%?

Diplomacy doesn't directly cancel the chance of combat. First the outcome is chosen between the 4 possible events (Artefact, Death, Fight and Return on Mankarog zones), and if Fight is chosen, it is cancelled and another outcome is picked among the 3 others.


Pyrrhus

Q279 How long do you suppose a hypothetical 'Optimum' ship could last? (All gold players/controlled by one person/best bps, not perfect run of RNG results like the available NERON projects). In relation (more to SDF I guess), are the jumps in difficulty after day 5, 10 and 15 inherent to the programming or are they a discrete part of the game?

There are only two jumps in difficulty, day 6 and day 12, but they are not exactly jumps, because the increase of difficulty is progressive. Metal plates don't start falling suddenly Day 12 Cycle 1.

There are 2 factors that increase difficulty : time (the longer a ship lasts, the more difficult things get), and the level of activity of the ship (the difficulty is linked to the number of AP spent by the crew).


LaforetQ282 Does the mycoalarm activates when someone traps food or eats spored food, or only when they are directly spiked by the MUSH?

Mycoalarms only detect direct spiking.

If you do happen to get flagged, then you can PM the Mod inbox, and explain the situation. You'll have to do this in order to be able to jump on another ship. As long as no rules have been broken, and the mod(s) understand the situation, then both of your accounts may be authorized to play again.

The main reason people get flagged is because they try to use multiple accounts, and MT's rules are explicit that a person may only have one account.

Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

A 241
- They take off if they come across the bay or if they are placed there.
- They only take off at cycle change if there are enemy ships outside.
- They do one action per cycle if they are not upgraded. As taking off counts as an action, they won't fire until the following cycle. If they have the Turbo upgrade, they have 80 % chance of doing two actions (either taking off then firing once, or firing twice, or firing then landing).
- They do random damage and don't prioritise specific ships, but they have a 20 % targeting bonus.
- They only land when there are no hunters left or if their patrol ship has no charges left. If you don't have Magnetic Net (not Return, that's for the Icarus), you will lose the patrol ship and the drone. If you have Magnetic Net, the patrol ship doesn't land but stays outside and moves alongside the Daedalus, like trax.

spacekadt
Spazticus

A206: Tell them that the best places to keep extinguishers are the corridors, and to always update the Extinguishers thread with their current locations. One thing about post-its though...they don't actually prevent items from burning. Every item in a room has a chance of burning each cycle, and each gets tested separately. So a Post-it burning wouldn't prevent another item from burning, it would just burn, too. That "trick" doesn't actually work.

Post-its are still wonderful to have on expos, however.

Because this got attributed on the wiki, I'm debating this point.

Technically, the post its don't prevent anything. But when you have a room with 5 plants and that's all, you have a 100% chance that a plant (or more) will be consumed. When you have a room with 5 plants and 95 post it notes, you have a 5% chance that a plant (or more) is consumed. It's not a thought that fires consume certain items first, it's an attempt to play the odds and give a fire something *other* than plants to destroy in hopes the RNG picks those instead.

It's simple statistics, really.
On february 10, 2014
Peanutz
Mais pourquoi est-il aussi mÃ©chant ?

No, it doesn't work that way. Each item has its individual chance of being destroyed or damaged, it doesn't depend on the number of objects in the room. (See here for confirmation... sorry, it's not in English).
